thread.title: H.S. Girls Tennis: Glen Rock seeks strong finish
thread.title_full: H.S. Girls Tennis: Glen Rock seeks strong finish

title: H.S. Girls Tennis: Glen Rock seeks strong finish
text:
Print 
Although the Glen Rock High School girls tennis team lost its North 1, Group 1 state-quarterfinal match at Cresskill, 3-2, the Panthers entered the final stages of the season with a 10-4 record and a chance to at least tie for the NJIC Colonial Division championship that they won last season. Buy this photo Photo courtesy of Bonnie Zimmermann Senior first singles Jennie Miller scored victories in both of the Glen Rock girls tennis team's state-tournament wins, defeating opponents from Midland Park and Cresskill. 
Head coach Bonnie Zimmermann said, "The Cresskill match could have gone either way, as we were closely matched. We had to change the lineup, and Celia Hans moved up to third singles instead of Mikaela Rosen. And one of the first doubles players, Kayla Gutnikova, was out sick as well." 
The first and second singles players won their matches against Cresskill, Jennie Miller at No. 1 and Haley Rosenwald at No. 2. The coach said Miller was steady and in charge as usual and Rosenwald faced a player very similar to herself. She said both hit fast shots and moved very well." 
She said Hans stepped up to play a tough third singles match. "She had some great points and really moved well during the long rallies." 
The coach said the revamped first doubles team of Janet Downing and Kaitlin Stansel sustained a tough loss to Cresskill's team. "They were setting up nice points and had close games," she said. 
The young second doubles team of sophomore Kate Gifford and freshman Emma Mangino went three sets but lost in their debut match. "They were both focused and determined to win," Zimmermann said. "While they were disappointed by their loss, I told them that their competitive play and determination showed that the future of Glen Rock girls tennis is bright." 
All of the Glen Rock regulars are seniors and the coach said next year will be a fresh start. 
With four league matches to play, Glen Rock had lost only to Rutherford and hoped to at least share the title. Hawthorne, Pompton Lakes, Lodi and Mary Help of Christians were the league opponents left on the schedule. The Panthers had a 9-1 record in the division. 
The season started on a sour note with a 4-1 loss at Mahwah, but then the Panthers won eight in a row before losing to Leonia. They opened state-tournament play with a 5-0 victory over Midland Park.
